attributes.description: Operating frequency band used by the SATCOM Module for secure satellite communication links.
attributes.name: operatingFrequency

attributes.description: Maximum data transfer rate achievable by the module under peak conditions.
attributes.name: dataRate

attributes.description: Redundancy configuration to ensure continuous operation even under hardware failure, featuring triple backup transceivers.
attributes.name: redundancy

attributes.description: Encryption protocol used to secure data transmissions across the satellite network.
attributes.name: encryptionProtocol

attributes.description: Maximum allowable end-to-end communication latency for real-time operational requirements.
attributes.name: latency

designScenario.description: The SATCOM Module 2.0 is an advanced satellite communication system designed for next-generation passenger aircraft. It facilitates continuous, secure, and high-performance communication with satellite networks to support real-time flight data exchange, navigational updates, and dynamic weather information. The module integrates advanced encryption algorithms, triple redundancy in transceivers, and a high-gain antenna system that operates in the Ku-band to meet stringent aviation communication requirements.
designScenario.name: SATCOM Module 2.0

details.description: Enable reliable bidirectional communication with multiple satellite systems to ensure uninterrupted connectivity for real-time flight updates.
Seamlessly integrate with onboard avionics to support operational commands and telemetry.
Achieve a data throughput of up to 1.5 Mbps even in high-demand scenarios.
Maintain an end-to-end latency of less than 400ms to support timely system responses.
Implement triple redundant transceivers and sophisticated error detection methods to mitigate potential failures.
Provide immediate alerts and fallback procedures to enhance flight safety in adverse conditions.
Adopt a modular architecture that supports ease of maintenance, scalability, and future system upgrades.
Ensure compliance with aviation electromagnetic interference standards and cybersecurity best practices.

relationships.description: The SATCOM Module 2.0 is composed of several critical hardware components including an advanced antenna, redundant transceivers, a secure encryption unit, and a high-speed data interface.
The module integrates multiple transceivers to ensure redundancy and continuous operation.
The Secure Encryption Unit is associated with the SATCOM Module 2.0 to provide end-to-end data encryption.
The High-speed Data Interface module depends on the Central Avionics Processor to transmit processed communication data for onward usage.

systemComponents.description: The main satellite communication unit that integrates all subcomponents to provide advanced SATCOM functionalities for passenger aircraft.
systemComponents.name: SATCOM Module 2.0

subComponents.description: A high-gain antenna system engineered to effectively transmit and receive satellite signals in the Ku-band.
subComponents.name: Advanced SATCOM Antenna

subComponents.description: A set of dual redundant transceivers with an additional standby unit to ensure uninterrupted communication.
subComponents.name: Dual Redundant Transceivers

subComponents.description: An enhanced encryption unit that employs AES-256 with RSA key exchange to secure all data transmissions in real-time.
subComponents.name: Secure Encryption Unit V2

subComponents.description: A high-speed data interface module that manages and relays communication data between the SATCOM Module and other avionics systems.
subComponents.name: High-speed Data Interface
